definition: tending to show favour towards or against one group of people or one opinion for personal reasons; making unfair judgements
having a particular interest in one thing more than others
having a particular color or different colors
a word used to describe a person who is not white, which is now considered offensive
(in South Africa) having parents who are of different races
having a particular colour or different colours
a word used to describe a person who is not white, which is now considered offensive
(in South Africa) having parents who are of different races
showing only one side of the situation; not balanced
involving people who have different abilities; involving one person more than another
sloping in one direction
tending to be in favour of one person or thing in a way that may be unfair to others
that cannot be cured
that cannot be changed
a type of strong material with a hard shiny surface, used for covering floors
relating to the part of philosophy that deals with knowledge
relating to knowledge
to make somebody extremely angry
a substance that produces a pleasant smell when you burn it, used particularly in religious ceremonies
the fact of tending not to take things as seriously as other people think you should
not interesting or exciting
the normal order and way in which you regularly do things
a situation in which life is boring because things are always done in the same way
a series of movements, jokes, etc. that are part of a performance
a list of instructions that enable a computer to perform a particular task
ordinary; not special in any way
ordinary; not very interesting
the act of stating officially that something, usually a marriage, is not legally recognized
a short simple aria in opera
the act of changing to a lower gear in a vehicle
the act of changing to a job or style of life where you may earn less but that puts less pressure on you and involves less stress
to change into a higher gear in a vehicle
a large brass musical instrument like a tuba

a character in Shakespeare's play The Merchant of Venice. He is a Jewish moneylender who demands a pound of flesh from somebody who cannot pay back the money that he borrowed. Although the play shows him as a person who is treated badly as well as a person who treats others badly, his name is sometimes used in a negative way to describe people who lend money at very high rates of interest.
a person who lends money to people at unfairly high rates of interest
a person whose business is lending money, usually at a very high rate of interest
not arranged in an even way; not having an even, smooth pattern or shape
not happening at times that are at an equal distance from each other; not happening regularly
not according to the usual rules
not formed in the normal way
not part of a country’s official army
fighting against the government or armed forces of their own country
showing too much support for one person, group or idea, especially without considering it carefully
the scientific study of volcanoes
a spacecraft in the shape of a tube that is driven by a stream of gases let out behind it when fuel is burned inside
a missile (= a weapon that travels through the air) that carries a bomb and is driven by a stream of burning gases
a firework that goes high into the air and then explodes with coloured lights
a plant with long green leaves that have a strong taste and are eaten raw in salads
to speak angrily to somebody because they have done something wrong; to be spoken to angrily for this reason
a plant with long green leaves that have a strong taste and are eaten raw in salads
a vehicle with two or four wheels that is pulled by a horse and used for carrying loads
a light vehicle with wheels that you pull or push by hand
a small vehicle with wheels that can be pushed or pulled along and is used for carrying things
a facility on a website that records the items that you select to buy
to put or do things in the wrong order
a small platform in a church that is like a box and is high above the ground, where a priest, etc. stands to speak to the people
related to or adapted for walking
that is not fixed in one place and can move around easily
able to walk; not having to stay in bed
the act of accepting that you have been defeated by an enemy or opponent
agreement to do something that you have been refusing to do for a long time
the act or quality of being generous with money; money that you give to people who have less than you
in my humble opinion (used especially in emails, in text messages, on social media, etc. when you give your opinion about something)
a man who believes men are more important, more intelligent or better than women
a person who has an aggressive and unreasonable belief that their own country is better than all others
a group of people, sometimes with trained animals, who perform acts with skill in a show that travels around to different places
a show performed by people who are members of a circus, usually in a large tent called the big top
a group of people or an event that attracts a lot of attention
(used in some place names) a round open area in a town where several streets meet
a place like a big round outdoor theatre for public games, races, etc.
